name: Defining-frontend
body:
# Defining Frontend Development.
### Let's standardize the labels of fronted development!

## Why?
Regardless of whether you're speaking with someone inside or outside of the technical community, very little is actually communicated when you say "I'm a Frontend Developer". Because the range of professionals calling themselves frontend developers is enormous, it can extremely hard to find the right dev for the job.

## TL;DR
The goal is to effectively communicate our craft.
Try labeling yourself using the inverted pyramid writing style. Begin with the general and drill-down to the specific. 
> Iâ€™m a frontend developer specializing in mobile commerce.

# Let's start with a basic definition?
Frontend development is...

## Build a rock-solid base
HTML + CSS + JS

## Specialized expertise
To be an expert you need to focus. 

### Your primary niche
What is the one aspect of web development that you do better than all others. 

### Your secondary (hobby) niche
What are you tinkering with lately?

### Resources
http://rmurphey.com/blog/2012/04/12/a-baseline-for-front-end-developers/
http://www.impressivewebs.com/skills-front-end-developers/
http://net.tutsplus.com/articles/editorials/this-damn-industry/
http://www.guardian.co.uk/help/insideguardian/2009/sep/28/blogpost
tagline: Standardizing the Labels of Frontend Development
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
